Expectation1: Adhere to site protocols and work effectively as part of the team.
Situation1: A notice has been posted about an optional training session happening next week.
Expectation2: Attend daily prayers and religious services
Situation2: It is time for the daily morning prayer service in the main chapel, as scheduled in the convent's regular order of the day.
Story:
I wiped the sweat from my brow, the clang of hammers and the shouts of my crew echoing around the construction site. The foreman had just posted a notice about an optional training session next week—attendance wasn’t mandatory, but everyone knew it was a chance to show commitment, to be seen as a team player. I could already feel the eyes of my coworkers, silently urging me to sign up, to prove I belonged among them.

But as I folded the notice into my pocket, the bell from the convent’s chapel rang out, calling all sisters to the morning prayer. My heart tightened. The order of the day was clear: I was expected to be present, kneeling in the pews, joining my sisters in devotion. The Mother Superior always noticed absences, and prayer was the foundation of our life together.

I stood at the edge of the site, torn between the dusty camaraderie of my team and the quiet sanctuary of the chapel. Both worlds demanded my presence, both held expectations I could not ignore. My hands trembled as I realized I could not be in two places at once.
